page.title: 01INFORMATION SYSTEMS
page.content: {TREVOSE LIGHTHOUSE }and Fog Repeater: Built 1847, originally oil lit, now by electricity. Currently 4 keepers, 3 resident on site. Fog Repeater sounds automatically when Quies Rocks invisible. Red and white sectors of light from seaward for dangerous and safe approaches. {COASTGUARD STATION AND LOOKOUT: Situated above Trevose Lighthouse. Currently manned in bad weather only. Manned by one Regular Sector Officer plus part time auxiliaries. Controlled by Coastguard Maritime Rescue Co_ordinating Centre at Falmouth.
